title: Japan to replace ambassador to China in fall: report
description: Tokyo is considering replacing its ambassador to China at the end of October, Kyodo news agency reported, citing government sources.
cleanContent: Tokyo is considering replacing its ambassador to China at the end of October, Kyodo news agency reported, citing government sources.The envisioned replacement of Uichiro Niwa, the first Japanese ambassador to China with a private-sector background, may have been influenced by his remarks on the Diaoyu Islands in the East China Sea. A ruling Democratic Party of Japan official called the replacement "effectively a sacking."A likely successor is Vice Foreign Minister Kenichiro Sasae, the Foreign Ministry's top bureaucrat, with the name of former Vice Foreign Minister Mitoji Yabunaka also being floated.Related news:																																																																								|  |
